NRTAPmodel 1.0.0

    • Spatiotemporal cross validation types
    • Downloading EPA Daily Data

    Fit base learner

    fit_base_learner.Rd

    This function fits a selected base learner, which is supposed to be one of random forest, XGBoost, and convolutional neural network, using one of spatiotemporal cross-validation approaches.

    fit_base_learner(
  covars,
  learner = c("randomforest", "xgboost", "cnn"),
  dependent_name = "pm2.5",
  independent_name,
  cv_mode = c("lolo", "loto", "lolto", "random", "lblo", "lbto", "lblto"),
  cv_fold = 5L,
  return_full_object = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    covars

    stdt. See convert_stobj_to_stdt

    learner

    character(1). Currently one of 'randomforest', 'xgboost', and 'cnn'

    dependent_name

    character(1). Name of the dependent variable.

    independent_name

    character(1). Names of independent variables.

    cv_mode

    character(1). One of 'lolo (leave-one-location-out)', 'loto (leave-one-time-out)', 'lolto (leave-one-location-time-out)', 'lblo (leave-block-location-out)', 'lbto (leave-block-time-out)', 'lblto (leave-block-location-time-out)', and 'random (full random selection)'

    cv_fold

    integer(1). Number of folds for cross-validation.

    return_full_object

    logical(1). TRUE will return the object whose class is dependent on the package in use, whereas FALSE will only return the prediction with spatial/temporal information. Full object is potentially helpful for debugging.

    Value

    data.frame

    Author

    Insang Song

    Contents

    Developed by Kyle Messier, Insang Song, Eva Marques, Mitchell Manware, Daniel Zilber, Anisha Singh, Lara Clark, Cavin Ward-Caviness.
